issue.title: SIKE p-503 and p-610 failing memory leak tests
issue.body:
When compiled using `clang-14` the latest SIKE code fails this valgrind test as follows (only for p-503 and p-610; all other parameters pass):
```
root@f9e0d5466559:~/project/build/tests# valgrind -s --error-exitcode=1 --leak-check=full --show-leak-kinds=all ./test_kem SIKE-p503
==7236== Memcheck, a memory error detector
==7236== Copyright (C) 2002-2017, and GNU GPL'd, by Julian Seward et al.
==7236== Using Valgrind-3.15.0 and LibVEX; rerun with -h for copyright info
==7236== Command: ./test_kem SIKE-p503
==7236== 
Configuration info
==================
Target platform:  x86_64-Linux-5.13.0-1023-aws
Compiler:         clang (14.0.6 )
Compile options:  [-march=skylake;-Werror;-Wall;-Wextra;-Wpedantic;-Wno-unused-command-line-argument;-O3;-fomit-frame-pointer;-Wbad-function-cast;-Wcast-qual;-Wnarrowing;-Wconversion]
OQS version:      0.7.2-dev
Git commit:       58b73c1044d7731b9210e4d6e6e919466323c134
OpenSSL enabled:  Yes (OpenSSL 1.1.1f  31 Mar 2020)
AES:              NI
SHA-2:            OpenSSL
SHA-3:            C
OQS build flags:  OQS_OPT_TARGET=skylake CMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=Release 
CPU exts compile-time:  ADX AES AVX AVX2 BMI1 BMI2 PCLMULQDQ POPCNT SSE SSE2 SSE3

================================================================================
Sample computation for KEM SIKE-p503
================================================================================
shared secrets are equal
==7236== Thread 2:
==7236== Conditional jump or move depends on uninitialised value(s)
==7236==    at 0x4842225: bcmp (in /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/valgrind/vgpreload_memcheck-amd64-linux.so)
==7236==    by 0x10A726: kem_test_correctness (in /root/project/build/tests/test_kem)
==7236==    by 0x10A43B: test_wrapper (in /root/project/build/tests/test_kem)
==7236==    by 0x4C7F608: start_thread (pthread_create.c:477)
==7236==    by 0x4DB9132: clone (clone.S:95)
==7236== 
==7236== Conditional jump or move depends on uninitialised value(s)
==7236==    at 0x10A729: kem_test_correctness (in /root/project/build/tests/test_kem)
==7236==    by 0x10A43B: test_wrapper (in /root/project/build/tests/test_kem)
==7236==    by 0x4C7F608: start_thread (pthread_create.c:477)
==7236==    by 0x4DB9132: clone (clone.S:95)
==7236== 
==7236== 
==7236== HEAP SUMMARY:
==7236==     in use at exit: 0 bytes in 0 blocks
==7236==   total heap usage: 25 allocs, 25 frees, 27,372 bytes allocated
==7236== 
==7236== All heap blocks were freed -- no leaks are possible
==7236== 
==7236== Use --track-origins=yes to see where uninitialised values come from
==7236== ERROR SUMMARY: 2 errors from 2 contexts (suppressed: 0 from 0)
==7236== 
==7236== 1 errors in context 1 of 2:
==7236== Conditional jump or move depends on uninitialised value(s)
==7236==    at 0x10A729: kem_test_correctness (in /root/project/build/tests/test_kem)
==7236==    by 0x10A43B: test_wrapper (in /root/project/build/tests/test_kem)
==7236==    by 0x4C7F608: start_thread (pthread_create.c:477)
==7236==    by 0x4DB9132: clone (clone.S:95)
==7236== 
==7236==

==7236==    by 0x10A726: kem_test_correctness (in /root/project/build/tests/test_kem)
==7236==    by 0x10A43B: test_wrapper (in /root/project/build/tests/test_kem)

==7236== 
==7236== ERROR SUMMARY: 2 errors from 2 contexts (suppressed: 0 from 0)
```

issue.title: Compiling liboqs for x86 on Windows
issue.body:
Hello,

I'm trying to compile liboqs as a static library with Visual Studio 2022 for x86 without ninja.

Within the build folder I executed the following cmake command:
`cmake .. -A Win32 -DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=Release -DOQS_BUILD_ONLY_LIB=ON`

After this I used the following commands:
`msbuild ALL_BUILD.vcxproj`
and
`msbuild INSTALL.vcxproj`

The build and installation process finish successfully and I have the built library and header files within the C:\Program Files (x86)\liboqs directory.

I noticed that within the generated CMake Visual Studio project files, the default configuration is Debug and not Release.
If I compile it manually by opening the generated ALL_BUILD.vcxproj and setting the configuration to Release, it will compile using the Release configuration. The same will not happen by using msbuild commands.

Another issue that I have is that by using the compiled library by the method which I said above I'm getting the following linking errors when I try to compile a simple test project (example_kem.c):
- LNK2001	unresolved external symbol __subborrow_u64	
- LNK2001	unresolved external symbol __addcarry_u64
- LNK2001	unresolved external symbol __umul128
- LNK2001	unresolved external symbol ___shiftright128
- LNK2001	unresolved external symbol ___shiftleft128

All of the mentioned unresolved symbols are coming from oqs.lib.

Compiling the same project with x64 configuration with the x64 static library works without issues.

issue.title: Compiling liboqs for x86 on Windows
issue.body:
Hello,

I'm trying to compile liboqs as a static library with Visual Studio 2022 for x86 without ninja.

Within the build folder I executed the following cmake command:
`cmake .. -A Win32 -DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=Release -DOQS_BUILD_ONLY_LIB=ON`

After this I used the following commands:
`msbuild ALL_BUILD.vcxproj`
and
`msbuild INSTALL.vcxproj`

The build and installation process finish successfully and I have the built library and header files within the C:\Program Files (x86)\liboqs directory.

I noticed that within the generated CMake Visual Studio project files, the default configuration is Debug and not Release.
If I compile it manually by opening the generated ALL_BUILD.vcxproj and setting the configuration to Release, it will compile using the Release configuration. The same will not happen by using msbuild commands.

Another issue that I have is that by using the compiled library by the method which I said above I'm getting the following linking errors when I try to compile a simple test project (example_kem.c):
- LNK2001	unresolved external symbol __subborrow_u64	
- LNK2001	unresolved external symbol __addcarry_u64
- LNK2001	unresolved external symbol __umul128
- LNK2001	unresolved external symbol ___shiftright128
- LNK2001	unresolved external symbol ___shiftleft128

All of the mentioned unresolved symbols are coming from oqs.lib.

Compiling the same project with x64 configuration with the x64 static library works without issues.
